name: Cubicle Quest
description: Cubicle Quest is a game about how life can suck. Dead end jobs, repetitive obligations, irritating coworkers... Cubicle Quest takes all of those things and turns them into enemies you can fight in an old-school RPG.
minimum_requirements: OS: 98+ Processor: 800MHz Intel® Pentium® III or higher Memory: 128 MB RAM Graphics: 1024x768 or better video resolution in High Color mode Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: DirectSound-compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: I was given a pre-release key for this game to see if everything was fine before being released on the store, and as there may be alot of people out there looking at this game (First day launches tend to be... viewed alot) I decided to do a review of my first 30 minutes.   DON'T WANT TO READ? Here it is: Too expensive for its quality, weird for a game that beat KickStarter (1.6k) to have default textures everywhere. If it was cheaper, then I would recommend it.   About it

Don't buy it for 10$ but while it's on the 1$ special [just this week it looks like as of 8/30/2015], definitely get it. It's entertaining, funny, and oddly inspirational. I definitely share the sentiments of the other reviewers and discussion board posters that are appalled by this game using almost entirely exclusively non-original and RPG maker's sprites, artwork, and even music. And the game also got 1600$ from kickstarter. Speaking of oddly inspirational... that comes to mind. It's not a bad game itself, I'm enjoying it a lot. I think it's rather a great game. If you see it on sale for 3$ or less then you should maybe get it, but with the huge lack of creative artwork content and music [a big one], it's not worth 10$. The game itself though, bland aesthetics, disappointment bias about the kickstarter, and music aside, is pretty cool. Just not $10 cool.

SAVE everytime done fighting, SAVE everytime after check loots, SAVE everytime before talk with important  NPC  people. ESCAPE in early game, ESCAPE a trap, ESCAPE from reality. MUCH PARODY, MUCH SAVES ATTEMPT, MUCH ESCAPE ATTEMPT.  Actually bought this game only to get the trading card since the game was only $0.12 (after currency conversion), but it's better than i expected. Worth if you buy this game at discouned price and profit from trading card.
I like RPGMaker games. This one is quite generic content-wise, but the story and delivery is unique.
'I'm So Meta, Even This Acronym' is the cry of this game...just buy it. Really.
This is a hilarious rpg game!
Thanks god got it with 90% off, good for card collectors only.

This game is a rather simplistic rpgmaker game which sometimes lacks any real direction (so you have to find out what you should do next by trial and error) but that being said I have had a lot of fun playing it and highly recommend it.
IF U LOVE RPG PLAY THIS GAME.. enjoy ff in a new mode :v
i'm sayin' honestly that this game sucks My currency is into russian rubbles and it costed me only 4 rub which is 6.1 cents and i bought it for trading cards!
A fantastic quest to destroy Crushing Debt and Depresion!  I married Alayna.  I have no regrets.  10/10 Would Make Sandwhiches Again.
While i wish i could recommend this game, the overall difficulty thrown in your face and lack of direction with somewhat confusing and hard to remember place names makes it a big no from me.
so this is my story :v im playing cubicle quest at the first round so im want to rankup and then after that kablam boss fight then the boss skill me im dead :v but its fun to play
One of the best soundtracks i've heard

This game is so interesting... This is my first time playing funny RPG and if you want to play this game on full screen just press alt+enter... I'm sorry, i can't review so much for this game because it's just same like other's RPG but the story in this game little funny... That's my review for this game and i hope you enjoy this game... :)
